trans-unit.source: When you send template notifications you only need to provide a set of properties, in our case we will send the set of properties containing the localized version of the current news, for instance:

trans-unit.source: This section shows how to send notifications using a console app
trans-unit.target: This section shows how to send notifications using a console app

trans-unit.source: The included code broadcasts to both Windows Store and iOS devices, since the backend can broadcast to any of the supported devices.
trans-unit.target: The included code broadcasts to both Windows Store and iOS devices, since the backend can broadcast to any of the supported devices.

trans-unit.source: To send notifications using a C# console app
trans-unit.target: To send notifications using a C# console app

trans-unit.source: Modify the `SendTemplateNotificationAsync` method in the console app you previously created with the following code.
trans-unit.target: Modify the `SendTemplateNotificationAsync` method in the console app you previously created with the following code.

trans-unit.source: Notice how in this case there is no need to send multiple notifications for different locales and platforms.
trans-unit.target: Notice how in this case there is no need to send multiple notifications for different locales and platforms.

trans-unit.source: Note that this simple call will deliver the localized piece of news to **all** your devices, irrespective of the platform, as your Notification Hub builds and delivers the correct native payload to all the devices subscribed to a specific tag.
trans-unit.target: Note that this simple call will deliver the localized piece of news to **all** your devices, irrespective of the platform, as your Notification Hub builds and delivers the correct native payload to all the devices subscribed to a specific tag.
